actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on December 4, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Sandra Day O'Connor.

Mr. Smith (NJ) asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, December 4, 2023 for Morning-Hour debate and 2 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the expulsion of the gentleman from New York, Mr. Santos, the whole number of the House is 434.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 311
actions-list.actionItem: 114, 2 Present (Roll no. 691).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 878 — "Providing for the expulsion of Representative George Santos from the United States House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 221
actions-list.actionItem: 202, 1 Present (Roll no. 690).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 32.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5283, H.R. 5961 and S.J. Res. 32. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5283 and H.R. 5961 under a structured rule and S. J. Res. 32 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on each measure with one motion to recommit on H.R. 5283 and H.R. 5961 and one motion to commit on S. J. Res. 32.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 891. S.J. Res. 32 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)"."
The House proceeded with one-minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to five per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Sewell to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor Jared Timberlake, Sandhill Christian Baptist Church, Franklin Furnace, Ohio
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ashley Hinson to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
